abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Electricity
            Transmission and Conservation Project are to: (i) optimize
            investment in the power sector; (ii) improve sector
            finances; (c) expand energy conservation and demand
            management programs; and (d) improve sector institutional
            arrangements. The project comprises the following
            components: (a) transmission investment and rehabilitation
            programs of selected power utilities for the period
            1990-1993 including construction of transmission lines and
            installation of transformer capacity at power substations;
            and (b) Part A (1990-1991) of the National Electric Energy
            Conservation Program including works (installation of more
            efficient public lighting fixtures, loss reduction schemes),
            studies (load management, system loss reduction, improvement
            of efficiency industrial processes), research (improvement
            of electrical equipment performance, use of improved
            insulation material and construction technique for
            building/houses) and training.
